required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of NVL-520 in Patients With Advanced NSCLC and Other Solid Tumors Harboring ROS1 Rearrangement (ARROS-1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Study of the Highly Selective ROS1 Inhibitor NVL-520 in Patients With Advanced NSCLC and Other Solid Tumors (ARROS-1)

brief_summary.textblock:
Phase 1/2, dose escalation and expansion study designed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of NVL-520, determine the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D), and evaluate the antitumor activity in patients with advanced ROS1-positive (ROS1+) NSCLC and other advanced ROS1-positive solid tumors.
Phase 1 will determine the RP2D and/or maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of NVL-520 in patients with advanced ROS1-positive solid tumors.
Phase 2 will determine the objective response rate (ORR) as assessed by Blinded Independent Central Review (BICR) of NVL-520 at the RP2D. Secondary objectives will include the duration of response (DOR), time to response (TTR), progression-free survival (PFS), overall survival (OS), and clinical benefit rate (CBR) of NVL-520 in patients with advanced ROS1-positive NSCLC and other solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock:
In Phase 2, study patients will be enrolled into 5 distinct expansion cohorts:
- Cohort 2a: ROS1-positive NSCLC naïve to Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor (TKI) therapy.
- Cohort 2b: ROS1-positive NSCLC treated with 1 prior ROS1 TKI and no prior platinum-based chemotherapy with or without immunotherapy.
- Cohort 2c: ROS1-positive NSCLC treated with 1 prior ROS1 TKI and 1 prior platinum-based chemotherapy with or without immunotherapy.
- Cohort 2d: ROS1-positive NSCLC treated with ≥2 prior ROS1 TKIs and up to 1 prior platinum-based chemotherapy with or without immunotherapy.
- Cohort 2e: ROS1-positive solid tumor and progressed on any prior therapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 28 days of the first NVL-520 dose
Within 28 days of last patient dosed during dose escalation.

primary_outcome.description: To determine ORR as assessed by BICR

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events, as assessed by CTCAE, v5.0
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration at the end of the dosing interval (Ctau) of NVL-520
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the plasma concentration at the end of the dosing interval (Ctau) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the average plasma concentration (Cavg) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum concentration (Tmax) of NVL-520
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the time of maximum concentration (Tmax) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve at the end of the dosing interval (AUCtau) of NVL-520
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the area under the curve at the end of the dosing interval (AUCtau) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time 0 to 24 (AUC0-24) of NVL-520
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the area under the curve from time 0 to 24 (AUC0-24) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the area under the curve from time 0 to infinity (AUCinf) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the oral clearance (CL/F) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the volume of distribution (Vz/F) of NVL-520

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the half-life (t1/2) of NVL-520
Determine ORR as assessed by BICR
Determine DOR of NVL-520 until radiographic disease progression or death
Determine time to response of NVL-520
Determine PFS of NVL-520 until radiographic disease progression or death

arm_group.description: ROS1+ NSCLC naïve to TKI therapy
ROS1+ NSCLC treated with 1 prior ROS1 TKI and no prior platinum-based chemotherapy or immunotherapy
ROS1+ NSCLC treated with 1 prior ROS1 TKI and 1 prior platinum-based chemotherapy with or without immunotherapy
ROS1+ NSCLC treated with ≥2 prior ROS1 TKIs and up to 1 prior platinum-based chemotherapy with or without immunotherapy
ROS1+ solid tumor and progressed on any prior therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥18 years (Cohort 2e only: Age ≥12 years and weighing>40 kg).
2. Phase 1:
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic solid tumor with documented ROS1 rearrangement.
2. Cohorts 2a, 2b, 2c and 2d: Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic NSCLC with ROS1 rearrangement.
3. Cohort 2e: Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic solid tumor (other than NSCLC) with ROS1 rearrangement.
3. Prior anticancer treatment (except cohort 2a).
4. Phase 1: Must have evaluable disease (target or nontarget) according to RECIST 1.1. Phase 2: Must have measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1.
5. Adequate baseline organ function and bone marrow reserve.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient's cancer has a known primary driver alteration other than ROS1.
2. Known allergy/hypersensitivity to excipients of NVL-520.
3. Major surgery within 4 weeks of study entry.
4. Ongoing or recent anticancer therapy.
5. Actively receiving systemic treatment or direct medical intervention on another therapeutic clinical study.
